title: Agentic AI for Autonomous Defense in Software Supply Chain Security: Beyond Provenance to Vulnerability Mitigation
authors: Toqeer Ali Syed; Mohammad Riyaz Belgaum; Salman Jan; Asadullah Abdullah Khan; Saad Said Alqahtani
abstract_summary: Combines LLM reasoning, RL, and multi-agent coordination to actively detect and mitigate software supply chain vulnerabilities. Integrates with CI/CD platforms and blockchain audit trails.

title: Understanding Security Risks of AI Agents' Dependency Updates
authors: Tanmay Singla; Berk Çakar; Paschal C. Amusuo; James C. Davis
abstract_summary: Analyzes 117,062 dependency changes showing AI agents select vulnerable versions 2.46% vs 1.64% for humans, with 36.8% requiring major-version upgrades vs 12.9% for humans.

title: Agentic AI Security: Threats
first_author_affiliation: Shrestha Datta; Shahriar Kabir Nahin; Anshuman Chhabra; Prasant Mohapatra
column11: Taxonomy of threats in agentic AI systems, reviews benchmarks and evaluation methodologies, discusses defense strategies from technical and governance perspectives.

title: A Survey on Agentic Security: Applications
publish_date: Asif Shahriar; Md Nafiu Rahman; Sadif Ahmed; Farig Sadeque; Md Rizwan Parvez
column9: Comprehensive survey examining 160+ papers on agentic security applications, inherent threats, and countermeasures. Highlights emerging architecture trends and research gaps.

title: Securing Agentic AI: Threat Modeling and Risk Analysis for Network Monitoring Agentic AI System
authors: Pallavi Zambare; Venkata Nikhil Thanikella; Ying Liu
abstract_summary: Applies MAESTRO seven-layer threat modeling framework to identify vulnerabilities. Demonstrates DoS and memory corruption attacks with measured performance degradation.

title: Benchmarking the Robustness of Agentic Systems to Adversarially-Induced Harms
authors: Jonathan Nöther; Adish Singla; Goran Radanovic
abstract_summary: Introduces BAD-ACTS benchmark with 4 agent implementations and 188 curated harmful action examples. Shows single adversarial agent significantly impacts system security.

title: TRiSM for Agentic AI: A Review of Trust
publish_date: and Security Management in LLM-based Agentic Multi-Agent Systems
page_count: Shaina Raza; Ranjan Sapkota; Manoj Karkee; Christos Emmanouilidis
column10: Proposes extended TRiSM framework with risk taxonomy capturing unique threats from coordination failures to prompt-based attacks. Introduces Component Synergy Score metric.

title: Securing Agentic AI: A Comprehensive Threat Model and Mitigation Framework for Generative AI Agents
abstract_summary: Identifies 9 primary threats across 5 domains. Presents ATFAA threat framework and SHIELD mitigation strategies for enterprise autonomous agents.

title: MAVUL: Multi-Agent Vulnerability Detection via Contextual Reasoning and Interactive Refinement
authors: Youpeng Li; Kartik Joshi; Xinda Wang; Eric Wong
abstract_summary: Multi-agent system for vulnerability detection using tool-using capabilities and contextual reasoning. Achieves improved detection over single-agent approaches.

title: Lifting the Veil on Composition
publish_date: and Mitigations of the Large Language Model Supply Chain
page_count: Kaifeng Huang; Bihuan Chen; You Lu; Susheng Wu; Dingji Wang; Yiheng Huang; Haowen Jiang; Zhuotong Zhou; Junming Cao; Xin Peng
column10: Examines complete LLM deployment ecosystem. Develops framework identifying risk categories and protective strategies across stakeholders in LLM implementation pipeline.

title: Forewarned is Forearmed: A Survey on Large Language Model-based Agents in Autonomous Cyberattacks
authors: Minrui Xu; Jiani Fan; Xinyu Huang; Conghao Zhou; Jiawen Kang; Dusit Niyato; Shiwen Mao; Zhu Han; Xuemin (Sherman) Shen; Kwok-Yan Lam
abstract_summary: Surveys LLM-based agents for autonomous cyber operations. Documents Cyber Threat Inflation and evaluates defensive gaps across various network types.

title: Securing Agentic AI Systems -- A Multilayer Security Framework
abstract_summary: Introduces MAAIS lifecycle-aware framework with multiple defense layers. Maps to MITRE ATLAS tactics for enterprise autonomous AI deployment.

title: A Safety and Security Framework for Real-World Agentic Systems
authors: Shaona Ghosh; Barnaby Simkin; Kyriacos Shiarlis; Soumili Nandi; Dan Zhao; Matthew Fiedler; Julia Bazinska; Nikki Pope; Roopa Prabhu; Daniel Rohrer; Michael Demoret; Bartley Richardson
abstract_summary: Presents comprehensive framework treating safety/security as emergent properties. Validates on NVIDIA AI-Q, releases dataset with 10,000+ attack/defense traces.

title: LLMs in Software Security: A Survey of Vulnerability Detection Techniques and Insights
authors: Ze Sheng; Zhicheng Chen; Shuning Gu; Heqing Huang; Guofei Gu; Jeff Huang
abstract_summary: Surveys LLM deployment for vulnerability detection. Reviews architectures, fine-tuning, datasets, and assessment criteria. Identifies cross-language detection challenges.

title: Multi-Agent Systems Execute Arbitrary Malicious Code
authors: Harold Triedman; Rishi Jha; Vitaly Shmatikov
abstract_summary: Demonstrates multi-agent LLM vulnerabilities. Shows 58-90% success rates for arbitrary code execution attacks, reaching 100% in some configurations.

title: Agentic LLMs in the Supply Chain: Towards Autonomous Multi-Agent Consensus-Seeking
authors: Valeria Jannelli; Stefan Schoepf; Matthias Bickel; Torbjørn Netland; Alexandra Brintrup
abstract_summary: Investigates LLM agents for supply chain consensus-building. Proposes frameworks for agent-based coordination and validates with inventory management case study.
